info.title: Unified Engagement API
info.description:
#### Introduction
Welcome to the Unified API (Engagement) documentation. You can use this API to write to multiple third-party providers within the Engagement category.

[View common schema for Engagement](https://docs.supaglue.com/platform/common-schemas/engagement)

#### Base API URL

```
https://api.supaglue.io/engagement/v2
```

post.description:
Search accounts by name and/or domain. If both are specified, it will perform an AND operation.
Support:

| Provider  | Search By               |
| --------- | ----------------------- |
| Apollo    | name only               |
| Salesloft | name, domain            |
| Outreach  | name, domain            |

Note: only `read_from_cache=false` is supported at the moment.

filter.description: The criteria to upsert on. If both name and domain are specified, it would perform an AND operation. If more than one account is found that matches, then an error will be thrown.

name.description: The name of the account to upsert on. Supported for Outreach, Salesloft, and Apollo.

domain.description: The domain of the account to upsert on. Only supported for Outreach and Salesloft.

get.description:
Support:

| Provider   | Supported |
| ---------- | --------- |
| Salesloft  | Yes       |
| Outreach   | Yes       |
| Apollo     | No        |

post.description:
Upsert an account. If the account matching the given criteria does not exist, it will be created. If the account does exist, it will be updated.
Upsert by name is supported for Outreach, Salesloft, and Apollo. Upsert by domain is supported for Outreach and Salesloft. If both are specified, it will perform an AND operation.

upsert_on.description: The criteria to upsert on. If both name and domain are specified, it would perform an AND operation. If more than one account is found that matches, then an error will be thrown.

name.description: The name of the account to upsert on. Supported for Outreach, Salesloft, and Apollo.

domain.description: The domain of the account to upsert on. Only supported for Outreach and Salesloft.

post.description: Some providers do not support `primary` phone number type, in which case we will default to `mobile`. If both `primary` and `mobile` phone numbers are specified and only a single mobile number is possible, then `mobile` will be used and `primary` will be dropped.

Search contacts by email. Note: only `read_from_cache=false` is supported at the moment.
:::danger
For apollo, each unique email incurs a separate API call towards the ratelimit.
:::

emails.description: The emails to search for. This will be imeplemented as an OR search.

post.description: Note this uses an undocumented private api endpoint for Apollo and should be considered to be in alpha state

patch.description: Works for `apollo` and `outreach`. Not supported in `salesloft`

parameters.name: sequence_step_id
parameters.description: The ID of the sequence step.

post.description: Add a contact to a sequence. If the contact is already in the sequence, it will return the id of the existing sequence state.

Search sequence states by contact_id and/or sequence_id. Note: only `read_from_cache=false` is supported at the moment.
Support:

| Provider  | Search By               |
| --------- | ----------------------- |
| Apollo    | contact_id only         |
| Salesloft | contact_id, sequence_id |
| Outreach  | contact_id, sequence_id |

filter.description: If both contact_id and sequence_id are provided, the search will be performed as an AND search.

contact_id.description: The ID of the contact to filter on.

sequence_id.description: The ID of the sequence to filter on.

post.description:
Add multiple contacts to a sequence atomically. You must pass in the same sequenceId, userId and mailboxId for all the contact records.

Support:

| Provider  | Supported |
| --------- | --------- |
| Apollo    | Yes       |
| Outreach  | No        |
| Salesloft | No        |

records.description: Will use the batch endpoints when possible (e.g. Apollo)
Created records, in order passed in

tags.name: Accounts
tags.description: The `Account` Common Object represents a "company" or "account" in Engagements.

tags.name: Contacts
tags.description: The `Contact` Common Object represents a "contact" in Engagements.

tags.name: Sequences
tags.description: The `Sequence` Common Object represents a "sequence" in Engagements.

tags.name: Sequence States
tags.description: The `Sequence State` Common Object represents the state of a contact in a sequence, commonly known as a "sequence membership".

tags.name: Users
tags.description: The `User` Common Object represents a "user" in Engagements.

tags.name: Mailboxes
tags.description: The `Mailbox` Common Object is used to represent email mailbox, used within the application for sending and syncing emails.

x-api-key.name: x-api-key
x-api-key.description: API key to allow developers to access the API

mailbox_id.description: The ID of the mailbox to use for the sequence. Required for Apollo and Outreach. Unused for Salesloft.

user_id.description: The ID of the user who is performing the action. Required for Salesloft, optional for Apollo, unused for Outreach.

is_disabled.description: When disabled, cannot be used to send email.

is_locked.description: When locked, cannot send email or take most actions in the app. This is null when provider does not have such concept (e.g. apollo)

tags.description: Raw values in Outreach, ids in Apollo, and not supported in Salesloft

is_archived.description: When archived, cannot add contact to sequence or send mail.

share_type.description: The share type of the sequence. If `team` will share with the whole team. `private` will only share with the owner.

steps.description: Only returned when getting single sequence, not returned when listing sequences because it is too expensive to do so.

name.description: The name given by the user for the step. Used by Salesloft only.

interval_seconds.description: The interval (in seconds) until this step will activate after the previous step (in case of first step, relative to when prospect first enters a sequence); only applicable to interval-based sequences. This is 0 by default

date.description: The date this step will activate; only applicable to date-based sequences.

template.description: The email/message template to be used for this step. Only applicable for email or message steps.

name.description: The name of the template. In Outreach, if missing this will create an `invisible` template that doesn't show up in the templates list UI.

to.description: A list of default person and email address pairs to receive this template in the "to" field

cc.description: A list of default person and email address pairs to receive this template in the "cc" field

bcc.description: A list of default person and email address pairs to receive this template in the "bcc" field

is_reply.description: If true, this step will be sent as a reply to the previous step.

order.description: The step's display order within its sequence. Only applicable for Outreach when adding steps one at a time after the initial sequence creation, otherwise when creating steps together with sequence order is implicit based on the order of step within the step array. Salesloft does not use the `order` param, and order is instead determined by `interval_seconds` which translates into the `day` parameter

type.description:
The type of the sequence state. Note: `linkedin_send_message` is undocumented in Outreach and subject to change. See below for how these types are mapped:
Provider auto_email manual_email call task linkedin_send_message
Apollo auto_email manual_email call action_item linkedin_send_message
Outreach auto_email manual_email call task linkedin_send_message
Salesloft Email Email Phone Other (Not supported)

task_note.description: An optional note to be attached to this step.

tags.description: Raw values in Outreach, ids in Apollo, and not supported in Salesloft

type.description: The share type of the sequence. Setting to `team` will share with the whole team. `private` will only share with the owner.

name.description: The name given by the user for the step. Used by Salesloft only.

interval_seconds.description: The interval (in seconds) until this step will activate after the previous step (in case of first step, relative to when prospect first enters a sequence); only applicable to interval-based sequences. This is 0 by default

date.description: The date this step will activate; only applicable to date-based sequences.

template.description: The email/message template to be used for this step. Only applicable for email or message steps.

id.description: The ID of the template to use for this step.

name.description: The name of the template. In Outreach, if missing this will create an `invisible` template that doesn't show up in the templates list UI.

to.description: A list of default person and email address pairs to receive this template in the "to" field

cc.description: A list of default person and email address pairs to receive this template in the "cc" field

bcc.description: A list of default person and email address pairs to receive this template in the "bcc" field

is_reply.description: If true, this step will be sent as a reply to the previous step.

order.description: The step's display order within its sequence. Only applicable for Outreach when adding steps one at a time after the initial sequence creation, otherwise when creating steps together with sequence order is implicit based on the order of step within the step array. Salesloft does not use the `order` param, and order is instead determined by `interval_seconds` which translates into the `day` parameter

type.description:
The type of the sequence state. Note: `linkedin_send_message` is undocumented in Outreach and subject to change. See below for how these types are mapped:
Provider auto_email manual_email call task linkedin_send_message
Apollo auto_email manual_email call action_item linkedin_send_message
Outreach auto_email manual_email call task linkedin_send_message
Salesloft Email Email Phone Other (Not supported)

task_note.description: An optional note to be attached to this step.

template.description: The email/message template to be used for this step. Only applicable for email or message steps.

custom_fields.description: Custom properties to be inserted that are not covered by the common object. Object keys must match exactly to the corresponding provider API.

id.description: A unique identifier for the instance of the error. Provide this to support when contacting Supaglue.

detail.description: A detailed description of the error.
detail.example: Property values were not valid: [{"isValid":false,"message":"Property \"__about_us\" does not exist","error":"PROPERTY_DOESNT_EXIST","name":"__about_us","localizedErrorMessage":"Property \"__about_us\" does not exist"}]

problem_type.description: The Supaglue error code associated with the error.

title.description: A brief description of the error. The schema and type of message will vary by Provider.

code.description: The Supaglue error code associated with the error.

status.description: The HTTP status code associated with the error.

cause.description: The cause of the error. Usually the underlying error from the remote Provider.

body.message: Property values were not valid: [{"isValid":false,"message":"Property \"__about_us\" does not exist","error":"PROPERTY_DOESNT_EXIST","name":"__about_us","localizedErrorMessage":"Property \"__about_us\" does not exist"}]

application_name.description: The name of the application that generated the error.

body.message: Property values were not valid: [{"isValid":false,"message":"Property \"__about_us\" does not exist","error":"PROPERTY_DOESNT_EXIST","name":"__about_us","localizedErrorMessage":"Property \"__about_us\" does not exist"}]

example.detail: Property values were not valid: [{"isValid":false,"message":"Property \"__about_us\" does not exist","error":"PROPERTY_DOESNT_EXIST","name":"__about_us","localizedErrorMessage":"Property \"__about_us\" does not exist"}]
example.title: Property values were not valid

include_deleted_data.name: include_deleted_data
include_deleted_data.description: Whether to include data that was deleted in providers.

include_raw_data.name: include_raw_data
include_raw_data.description: Whether to include raw data fetched from the 3rd party provider.

created_after.name: created_after
created_after.description: If provided, will only return objects created after this datetime. Datetime must be in ISO 8601 format and URI encoded.

created_before.name: created_before
created_before.description: If provided, will only return objects created before this datetime. Datetime must be in ISO 8601 format and URI encoded.

modified_after.name: modified_after
modified_after.description: If provided, will only return objects modified after this datetime. Datetime must be in ISO 8601 format and URI encoded.

modified_before.name: modified_before
modified_before.description: If provided, will only return objects modified before this datetime. Datetime must be in ISO 8601 format and URI encoded.

page_size.name: page_size
page_size.description: Number of results to return per page. (Max: 1000)

remote_provider_page_size.name: page_size
remote_provider_page_size.description: Number of results to return per page. (Max: 100)

read_from_cache.name: read_from_cache
read_from_cache.description:
Whether to read from Supaglue's Managed Destination cache or to read directly from the provider. 


**NOTE**: `read_from_cache=true` requires you to have the object synced to the Supaglue Managed Destination.

x-customer-id.name: x-customer-id
x-customer-id.description: The customer ID that uniquely identifies the customer in your application
